author: Alan Henry
title: The Mounted Everything Workspace
text:
Go to permalink 
Lainz ’s setup is unique in a few ways, one of which that he has a pair of speakers mounted to monitor arms just above his displays. Really offers that whole surround sound feel. Beyond that though, the setup has a few more neat surprises in store. Here are some more photos. Advertisement 
Before we dive too deep, let’s talk about that monitor stand. It’s the most popular question Lainz has at the Reddit thread linked below, and here’s what that’s all about: 
They are a 6 monitor mount stand. It is a “cheap” stand compared to a lot of others. It goes under a few different names. [ link ]Specification: Suit: 6pcs 13”-27” monitor Load capacity: 10kg per monitor VESA: 75x75 and 100x100 Tilt: -90 to +90 degree Swivel: -90 to +90 degree Rotate: 360 degree 
Here’s another shot from the side, where you can see the monitors on the arms from a different angle—and check out that awesome Hellboy arm diagram on the wall. 
As for the gear on the top of the desk, this is from the Imgur gallery also linked below: Advertisement 
Dell U2715H - Asus MG279Q - Dell U2715HYulong D100II Headphone dac/amp with Focal Elear headphones, also dac for the Argon da2 v2 that powers my Argon 6340 speakers and 840 sub.Focusrite Scarlett 2i2 usb microphone input with a Audio Technica ATR2100-USB microphone.Qpad Mk-50 Keyboard and Logitech G500s mouse. 
There’s a shot of the interior of Lainz’s computer—and its specs (spoiler, it’s a pretty slick watercooled rig crammed into a good-looking Fractal Design Define S case)—over at Imgur, but you can go check that out yourself. Oh, and if you’re wondering about the lamp hanging from the ceiling? Yup, it’s from IKEA . 
Hit the link below to check out more photos, and to visit the full thread at the battlestations subreddit. While you’re there, give it an upvote, and let Lainz know we sent you—and that we love the setup! Advertisement Sponsored 
If you have a workspace of your own to show off, share them with us by adding it to our Lifehacker Workspace Show and Tell Flickr pool . Make sure any photos you include are at least 1280x720. Keeping them to 16:9 helps, too! Include a little text about the stuff you used, how you came up with the design, and any other relevant details. If your clever organization and good design sense catches our eye, you might be the next featured workspace!
